version.description: If this training material is versioned, its strongly recommended you use this property to list the version being displayed The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

workTranslation.description:
A work that is a translation of the content of this work. e.g. 西遊記 has an English workTranslation “Journey to the West”,a German workTranslation “Monkeys Pilgerfahrt” and a Vietnamese translation Tây du ký bình khảo.
Inverse property: translationOfWork.

conformsTo.description: This is used to state the Bioschemas profile that the markup relates to. The identifier can be the url for the version of this bioschemas class on github: https://github.com/BioSchemas/specifications/blob/master/TrainingMaterial/jsonld/TrainingMaterial_v1.0-RELEASE.json

identifier.description: The url of the version bioschemas profile that was used. For jsonschema, set @id to the identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Bioschemas profile for describing a name of a biological taxon, which may be valid (zoology) / accepted (botany) or not. This profile povides a way to denote the scientific names of a taxon. The taxon accepted/valid name is linked to the taxon with property scientificName while the synonyms are linked with property alternateScientificName. Version: 1.0-RELEASE.

Summary of Changes


Changes since Version 0.2-DRAFT:
  • None. Version 0.2-DRAFT was approved to become a release
@graph.rdfs:label: TaxonName

additionalType.description: An equivalent TaxonName type from a well known vocabulary, e.g. TDWG: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/TaxonName#TaxonName An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

author.description: Authorship and date information associated to this taxon name, formatted as per the numenclatural rules The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

identifier.description:
A PropertyValue should be used to relate the taxon name with counterpart identifiers within well known authorities such as GBIF, WoRMS, EoL etc.
Wikidata properties may be used in this respect, e.g.:
NCBI id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P685), 
GBIF id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P846),
EoL id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P830), 
iNaturalist id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P3151), 
WoRMS id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P850), 
Fishbase id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P938),
TAXREF id (https://www.wikidata.org/entity/P3186),
...
 The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

isBasedOn.description: A CreativeWork, such as a scholarly article that coined the name or asserted its status A resource from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption. Supersedes isBasedOnUrl.

name.description: A name of that taxon without authorship and date information The name of the item.

taxonRank.description: The taxonomic rank of this taxon given preferably as a URI from a controlled vocabulary – (typically the ranks from TDWG TaxonRank ontology or equivalent Wikidata URIs).

url.description: Link to the webpage associated to this taxon URL of the item.

sameAs.description: URL of additional sources for the dataset

conformsTo.description: This is used to state the Bioschemas profile that the markup relates to. The identifier can be the url for the version of this bioschemas class on github: https://github.com/BioSchemas/specifications/blob/master/TaxonName/jsonld/TaxonName_v1.0-RELEASE.json

identifier.description: The url of the version bioschemas profile that was used. For jsonschema, set @id to the identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: One of pseudogene, dead, killed, live, predicted, suppressed.

@graph.rdfs:comment: A TaxonName representing the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name for that taxon.
@graph.rdfs:label: scientificName

@graph.rdfs:comment: A TaxonName representing a scientific name, with authorship and date information if known, of a synonym of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name.

@graph.rdfs:comment:
A resource from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption. Supersedes, isBasedOnUrl. 
 A CreativeWork, such as a scholarly article, asserting the status of the accepted/valid name and synonyms, retained for the taxon circumscription.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Datasets contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is an environment to find and access and infectious and immune-mediated disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

citedBy.description: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the work.

date.description: Date the work has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the work, not any associated publications.

isRelatedTo.description: Datasets which are related to the given dataset; often datasets involved in the same study. These linkages are created via human curation.

measurementTechnique.description: A technique or technology used in a  dataset corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using variableMeasured). For example, if variableMeasured is molecule concentration, measurementTechnique could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence".

citation.description: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the dataset. Examples: a publication which describes the collection/analysis of the dataset, a publication which reuses the dataset in a secondary analysis, a dataset which extends the existing dataset, or a computational tool which relies on the dataset.

@graph.rdfs:comment: ComputationalTools (software, workflows, computational tools, code) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the work. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished).

contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the developement or maintenance of the computational tool

creator.description: The creator/author of this work; equivalent to author

dateModified.description: Date the work was modified

datePublished.description: Date the work was first published

discussionUrl.description: A link to a webpage containing the comments about the computational tool.

hasPart.description: An item that is part of this computational tool

inLanguage.description: The language of the computational tool (not programming language)

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions with the work, such as page views or tool downloads.

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the work is accessible for free.

isBasedOn.description: A dataset, publication, or computational tool from which this work is derived, modified, or adapted.
isBasedOn.abstract: dataset, publication, or tool used to create the work

isPartOf.description: Indicates a broader study, project, or collection the work is part of.
isPartOf.abstract: study or project including the work

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this work.

license.description: A license document that applies to this work, typically indicated by URL.

sdPublisher.description: Original publisher of the computational tool metadata (like GitHub, Dockstore, etc.)

description.description: A description of the computational tool

name.description: Computational tool name

sameAs.description: URL of additional sources for the work.

url.description: URL of the work.

name.description: Title of the publication

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the citation such as a digital object identifier (DOI), PubMed ID (PMID), or PubMed Central ID (PMCID)

pmid.description: A PubMed identifier (PMID) of the referenced publication

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced publication

issueNumber.description: Issue number where the article appears

pagination.description: Page numbers in the journal where the article appears

url.description: The url of the arrticle

volumeNumber.description: Volume of the journal where the article appears

url.description: Link to data or tool catalog

versionDate.description: date the metadata was harvested from the catalog

author.description: Author(s) of the referenced work

additionalType.description: Additional type of the referenced work, such as a Sample, Run, Experiment, or BioProject

datePublished.description: Date the referenced work was published

hasPart.description: A portion of the work

name.description: Name or title

citation.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced work as is provided

role.description: What role the organization played in creating the computational tool

@graph.rdfs:comment: ResourceCatalogs (collections of scientific information or research outputs) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. Resource catalogs include databases, repositories, knowledge bases, citation indices, software indices, browser-based data portals (web portals), etc. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is an environment to find and access and infectious and immune-mediated disease data, resources and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: ResourceCatalog

citedBy.description: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the work.

date.description: Date the work has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the work, not any associated publications.

isRelatedTo.description: Resources which are related to the given resource catalog. These linkages are created via human curation.

isSimilarTo.description: Resource catalogs which are similar to the work, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.

isBasisFor.description: A resource catalog which uses the resource catalog.

relationship.description: How an associated work is related to the resource catalog.

topicCategory.description: Topic of the work. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.

infectiousAgent.description: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the resource catalog (like SARS-CoV-2), whenever applicable

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

healthCondition.description: The health condition(s) /infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the resource catalog (like COVID-19, coronavirus), whenever applicable

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

name.description: The health condition(s) /infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the work (ex: COVID-19)

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

name.description: The health condition(s) /infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the work (ex: COVID-19)

funding.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the creation or maintenance of the resource catalog through some kind of financial contribution.

items.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

description.description: description of the funding award / grant

funder.description: An organization or person who funded the creation of the work

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant or contract used to fund the work

url.description: award / grant URL

species.description: Species / host organism which is the focus of the resource catalog (whenever applicable).

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

name.description: Species / host organism from which the dataset has been collected.

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

name.description: Species / host organism from which the dataset has been collected.

distribution.description: A downloadable form of the resource catalog, at a specific location, in a specific format.

dateModified.description: date the file was modified

includedInDataCatalog.description: A resource catalog where the resource catalog is published.

measurementTechnique.description: A technique or technology used to generate the data or information in the resource catalog corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using variableMeasured). For example, if the resource catalog provides raw sequence reads (the variableMeasured), the measurementTechnique could be: "biopolymer sequencing" or "protein sequencing" or "whole genome sequencing" etc. If a resource allows data or information collected through any means or methods, use the term, "any".
measurementTechnique.abstract: measurement technique used to collect the content of the resource catalog, if applicable. If not applicable, use "any".

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

name.description: The name of the measurement technique used

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

name.description: The name of the measurement technique used

variableMeasured.description: Variables measured within the content of the resource catalog.

abstract.description: Short description that summarizes a work.

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the work. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.

author.description: Author or creator of the work.

citation.description: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the resource catalog. Examples: a publication which describes the creation of the resource catalog, a publication which uses information or content of the resource catalog for secondary analysis, or a computational tool which relies on the content of the resource catalog.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the work. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished).

creator.description: The creator/author of this work; equivalent to author

usageInfo.description: Data usage agreement, specifying the terms under which the content from the resource catalog can be used. Note that this is related to but distinct from the license.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Publications that cite the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: citedBy

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.
@graph.rdfs:label: date

@graph.rdfs:comment: Digital object identifier (DOI) for the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: doi

@graph.rdfs:comment: Repository or source which contains the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: includedInDataCatalog

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool which incorporate this dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: isBasisFor

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool which are related to the given dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool
@graph.rdfs:label: isRelatedTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool which are similar to the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: isSimilarTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier associated with the Dataset
@graph.rdfs:label: nctid

@graph.rdfs:comment: How an associated work is related to the dataset, resource/resource catalog
@graph.rdfs:label: relationship

@graph.rdfs:comment: Topic of the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.
@graph.rdfs:label: topicCategory

@graph.rdfs:comment: The type of resource/resource catalog that best describes the work.
@graph.rdfs:label: collectionType

@graph.rdfs:comment: The number of records, datasets, tools, items, pages, etc. in the resource/resource catalog
@graph.rdfs:label: collectionSize

@graph.rdfs:comment: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool (e.g. SARS-CoV-2)
@graph.rdfs:label: infectiousAgent

@graph.rdfs:comment: The infectious disease(s) / health condition(s) which are the focus of the dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool (e.g. COVID-19, coronavirus)
@graph.rdfs:label: healthCondition

@graph.rdfs:comment: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of a dataset, resource/resource catalog or computational tool through some kind of financial contribution
@graph.rdfs:label: funding

@graph.rdfs:comment: A downloadable form of the dataset, resource/resource catalog, at a specific location, in a specific format.
@graph.rdfs:label: distribution

@graph.rdfs:comment: Species(es) from which dataset has been collected, or is the focus of a resource/resource catalog, or for which the tool was designed or applied.
@graph.rdfs:label: species

@graph.rdfs:comment: A technique, method or technology used in an Observation, StatisticalVariable or Dataset (or DataDownload, DataCatalog), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using variableMeasured; for Observation, a StatisticalVariable). For example, if variableMeasured is: molecule concentration, measurementTechnique could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the variableMeasured is "depression rating", the measurementTechnique could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory".
@graph.rdfs:label: measurementTechnique

@graph.rdfs:comment: The variableMeasured property can indicate (repeated as necessary) the variables that are measured in some dataset, either described as text or as pairs of identifier and description using PropertyValue, or more explicitly as a StatisticalVariable.
@graph.rdfs:label: variableMeasured

_status.refresh_msg: no need to update, already at latest version

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing an ELISA result for a Patient in the Center for Viral Systems Biology experiments
@graph.rdfs:label: ELISA

@graph.rdfs:comment: Virus tested in ELISA (Ebola, Lassa, or SARS-CoV-2)
@graph.rdfs:label: virus

@graph.rdfs:comment: Type of ELISA: IgG, IgM, or Ag
@graph.rdfs:label: assayType

@graph.rdfs:comment: Result of ELISA, either positive/negative/indeterminate
@graph.rdfs:label: elisaResult

@graph.rdfs:comment: Result of ELISA, as a quantitative calibrated value
@graph.rdfs:label: elisaValue

@graph.rdfs:comment: sampleID associated with the ELISA measurement
@graph.rdfs:label: sampleID

@graph.rdfs:comment: description of the time at which the ELISA was taken, e.g. at patient presentation, survivor enrollment etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: timepoint

@graph.rdfs:comment: description of whether the data is considered preliminary (subject to review) or finalized. Note that "final" data can still be modified.
@graph.rdfs:label: dataStatus

@graph.rdfs:comment: Publisher of this dataset, usually the host organization
@graph.rdfs:label: publisher

@graph.rdfs:comment: Journal article or other publication associated with the dataset (stored as an object, not a string)
@graph.rdfs:label: citation

@graph.rdfs:comment: List of changes / corrections made to the data
@graph.rdfs:label: correction

@graph.rdfs:comment: Internal tracking of who / which file(s) supplied the ELISA data
@graph.rdfs:label: sourceFiles

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a Patient/Person in the Center for Viral Systems Biology experiments
@graph.rdfs:label: Patient

@graph.rdfs:comment: Unique, public study ID for patient
@graph.rdfs:label: patientID

@graph.rdfs:comment: Species of patient (Homo sapiens, Hylomyscus pamfi, Mastomys erythroleucus, Mastomys natalensis, rodent, etc)
@graph.rdfs:label: species

@graph.rdfs:comment: Alternative ID(s) used for patient (including G-number, S-number, or C-numbers, available to consortia members only)
@graph.rdfs:label: alternateIdentifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: Internal G-number used to refer to the patients when they're in the acute treatment phase at KGH. For most samples, should be a single gID; however, some patients have two.
@graph.rdfs:label: gID

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether CViSB has data, metadata, and/or samples from the acute phase of infection of the patient.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasPatientData

@graph.rdfs:comment: Internal survivor ID used to refer to the patients during follow-up visits. Can include either survivors (S-numbers) or contacts (C-numbers)
@graph.rdfs:label: sID

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether CViSB has data, metadata, and/or samples from follow-up visits after the patient has survived the acute infection phase.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasSurvivorData

@graph.rdfs:comment: ID group for patient and associated contacts
@graph.rdfs:label: contactGroupIdentifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date on which the Patient metadata was most recently modified
@graph.rdfs:label: dateModified

@graph.rdfs:comment: Person who updated the patient data
@graph.rdfs:label: updatedBy

@graph.rdfs:comment: description of whether the data is considered preliminary (subject to review) or finalized. Note that "final" data can still be modified.
@graph.rdfs:label: dataStatus

@graph.rdfs:comment: Internal tracking of who / which file(s) supplied the patient metadata
@graph.rdfs:label: sourceFiles

@graph.rdfs:comment: Version number of patient data
@graph.rdfs:label: version

@graph.rdfs:comment: Cohort for virus exposure: Ebola, Lassa, COVID-19, or control.  Note that this is not a diagnosis, but rather what the patient was being evaluated for.
@graph.rdfs:label: cohort

@graph.rdfs:comment: Outcome for patient: control, survivor, contact, dead, or unknown. Patients are considered survivors if they are alive at least 10 days after presentation of symptoms in the hospital, the time at which they are commonly discharged from the hospital.
@graph.rdfs:label: outcome

@graph.rdfs:comment: Country where Patient was exposed to the virus
@graph.rdfs:label: country

@graph.rdfs:comment: The most specific geographic location of the patient. Could be a combination of country (Administrative Unit 0), district (Administrative Unit 2), chiefdom (Administrative Unit 3), Village/City name, and/or GPS coordinates. SHOULD ONLY INCLUDE LOCATIONS THAT CAN BE RELEASED TO THE PUBLIC.
@graph.rdfs:label: location

@graph.rdfs:comment: The most specific geographic location of the patient. Could be a combination of country (Administrative Unit 0), district (Administrative Unit 2), chiefdom (Administrative Unit 3), Village/City name, and/or GPS coordinates.  Includes location information that should only be accessed by authorized users.
@graph.rdfs:label: locationPrivate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether the patient was admitted to the Lassa isolation ward at KGH.
@graph.rdfs:label: admittedLassaWard

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of admission in the hospital. Note that not all patients who are evaluated are admitted for further care.
@graph.rdfs:label: admitDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of first evaluation in the hospital. Note that not all patients who are evaluated are admitted for further care.
@graph.rdfs:label: evalDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of the first evaluation in the hospital; will be the minimum of the admitDate and evalDate
@graph.rdfs:label: presentationDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Week of presentation or first sample collection for the patient. Note that this date range could come from the date the patient was admitted to a health care facility, was evaluated, and/or a sample was collected and analyzed for them. This *may* be the week at which the patient was being treated in the acute phase of infection, or the date of first collection for a contact of an acutely ill patient, or it may be the date of a survivor follow-up visit where no data on their acute phase of illness is available.
@graph.rdfs:label: presentationWeek

@graph.rdfs:comment: Approximate year of infection or contact with the virus. Based on self-reporting, so take it with a grain of salt.  If the onset of symptoms isn't reported, based on the date the patient presented in the hospital or was discharged.
@graph.rdfs:label: infectionYear

@graph.rdfs:comment: Approximate date / date range of infection or contact with the virus. Based on self-reporting, so take it with a grain of salt.
@graph.rdfs:label: infectionDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of enrollment of the survivor or contact in the KGH survivor study
@graph.rdfs:label: survivorEnrollmentDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dates of evaluation of the survivor or contact in the KGH survivor study
@graph.rdfs:label: survivorEvalDates

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of discharge from the hospital
@graph.rdfs:label: dischargeDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of death
@graph.rdfs:label: deathDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Number of days between onset of symptoms and hospital admission, as self-reported
@graph.rdfs:label: daysOnset

@graph.rdfs:comment: Number of days between first evaluation and discharge or death
@graph.rdfs:label: daysInHospital

@graph.rdfs:comment: Occupation of patient
@graph.rdfs:label: occupation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Gender
@graph.rdfs:label: gender

@graph.rdfs:comment: A list of related household contacts's public patientIDs
@graph.rdfs:label: relatedTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: A list of related household contacts's private patientIDs
@graph.rdfs:label: relatedToPrivate

@graph.rdfs:comment: For contacts, the type or level of exposure they had to the infected person.
@graph.rdfs:label: exposureType

@graph.rdfs:comment: For contacts, how they are related to the infected person.
@graph.rdfs:label: contactSurvivorRelationship

@graph.rdfs:comment: Patient ethnicity
@graph.rdfs:label: ethnicity

@graph.rdfs:comment: Age at time of first presentation
@graph.rdfs:label: age

@graph.rdfs:comment: Patient height, in meters
@graph.rdfs:label: height

@graph.rdfs:comment: Patient weight, in kilograms
@graph.rdfs:label: weight

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether the patient was pregnant at the time of presentation
@graph.rdfs:label: pregnant

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether the patient was exposed to another person who had Lassa
@graph.rdfs:label: lassaExposed

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether the patient had recent Lassa-related deaths in their household
@graph.rdfs:label: lassaHHDeaths

@graph.rdfs:comment: Publisher of the Patient demographic data
@graph.rdfs:label: publisher

@graph.rdfs:comment: Journal article or other publication associated with the patient demographic data (stored as an object, not a string).  If no citation exists (as in, the experiment hasn't been published yet), should be the publisher associated with the patient.
@graph.rdfs:label: citation

@graph.rdfs:comment: A list of the changes made to the Patient metadata. Optional, but useful to tag when and/or why specific fields were changed.
@graph.rdfs:label: correction

@graph.rdfs:comment: List of symptoms the patient experienced during or after the course of illness.
@graph.rdfs:label: symptoms

@graph.rdfs:comment: List of medications administered (or not) to the patient during the course of their treatment.
@graph.rdfs:label: medications

@graph.rdfs:comment: List of ELISA results (IgG, IgM, Ag for Ebola/Lassa antigen) for the patient
@graph.rdfs:label: elisa

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a Country in the Center for Viral Systems Biology experiments
@graph.rdfs:label: Country

@graph.rdfs:comment: 2 letter ISO code of the country, e.g. SL
@graph.rdfs:label: identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: Link to the ISO country page
@graph.rdfs:label: url

@graph.rdfs:comment: Name of the country, e.g. Sierra Leone
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: Alternative name of the country, for instance in a different language
@graph.rdfs:label: alternateName

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a geographic AdministrativeArea in the Center for Viral Systems Biology. Used typically to specify province, district, village, etc. for regions of a Country. Note that for Administrative Unit 0 `Country` should be used instead
@graph.rdfs:label: AdministrativeArea

@graph.rdfs:comment: Name of the adminstrative area, e.g. Sierra Leone
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: Type of location for the patient: home, exposure location (presumably where he/she was infected), or unknown
@graph.rdfs:label: locationType

@graph.rdfs:comment: Alternative name of the admin area, for instance in a different language
@graph.rdfs:label: alternateName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Type of administative area, e.g. province (Adm 1), district (Adm 2), chiefdom (Adm 3), village (Adm 4)
@graph.rdfs:label: administrativeType

@graph.rdfs:comment: level of administative area, e.g. 1: province, 2: district, 3: chiefdom, 4: village for Sierra Leone
@graph.rdfs:label: administrativeUnit

@graph.rdfs:comment: identifier  / short name for administrative area. Note: where possible, align to governmental codes for the Administrative Area
@graph.rdfs:label: identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing an Symptom for a Patient in the Center for Viral Systems Biology experiments
@graph.rdfs:label: Symptom

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of when the symptoms were observed (e.g. at survivor enrollment, initial presentation in hospital, etc.)
@graph.rdfs:label: timepoint

@graph.rdfs:comment: Number of days between the admission date and when symptoms were observed. At initial clinical presentation, daysSinceAdmit = 0
@graph.rdfs:label: daysSinceAdmit

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing an PostalAddress for the Center for Viral Systems Biology
@graph.rdfs:label: PostalAddress

@graph.rdfs:comment: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy
@graph.rdfs:label: streetAddress

@graph.rdfs:comment: The locality (e.g. city). For example, Mountain View.
@graph.rdfs:label: addressLocality

@graph.rdfs:comment: The region (e.g. state/Adm 2). For example, CA.
@graph.rdfs:label: addressRegion

@graph.rdfs:comment: The postal code. For example, 94043.
@graph.rdfs:label: postalCode

@graph.rdfs:comment: The country object (containing name, ISO code/identifier, link to ISO page)
@graph.rdfs:label: addressCountry

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing an Organization for the Center for Viral Systems Biology
@graph.rdfs:label: Organization

@graph.rdfs:comment: Descriptive name of the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: Unique identifier of the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: Alternate name of the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: alternateName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: description

@graph.rdfs:comment: URL of the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: url

@graph.rdfs:comment: email of the Organization; could also be specified in contactPoint
@graph.rdfs:label: email

@graph.rdfs:comment: The larger organization that this organization is a subOrganization of, if any
@graph.rdfs:label: parentOrganization

@graph.rdfs:comment: logo for the organization
@graph.rdfs:label: logo

@graph.rdfs:comment: Contact point for the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: contactPoint

@graph.rdfs:comment: Postal address for the Organization
@graph.rdfs:label: address

@graph.rdfs:comment: A derivation of the schema.org Date class, for explicit bounded or unbounded date ranges. Used in json validation.
@graph.rdfs:label: DateRange

@graph.rdfs:comment: Inclusive upper bound of a date range
@graph.rdfs:label: lte

@graph.rdfs:comment: Exclusive upper bound of a date range
@graph.rdfs:label: lt

@graph.rdfs:comment: Inclusive lower bound of a date range
@graph.rdfs:label: gte

@graph.rdfs:comment: Exclusive lower bound of a date range
@graph.rdfs:label: gt

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a Person in the Center for Viral Systems Biology, mostly for the purposes of authorship of papers
@graph.rdfs:label: Person

@graph.rdfs:comment: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.
@graph.rdfs:label: givenName

@graph.rdfs:comment: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name
@graph.rdfs:label: additionalName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.
@graph.rdfs:label: familyName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Full name of the person-- concatenation of givenName, additionalName, familyName. givenName, additionalName, and familyName are the preferred way of specifying the name.
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a ContactPoint for the Center for Viral Systems Biology
@graph.rdfs:label: ContactPoint

@graph.rdfs:comment: contact type of the contactPoint
@graph.rdfs:label: contactType

@graph.rdfs:comment: url of the contactPoint
@graph.rdfs:label: url

@graph.rdfs:comment: email of the contactPoint
@graph.rdfs:label: email

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a ScholarlyArticle (a.k.a. a paper) in the Center for Viral Systems Biology
@graph.rdfs:label: ScholarlyArticle

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifier or DOI for publication
@graph.rdfs:label: identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: ISSN for publication
@graph.rdfs:label: issn

@graph.rdfs:comment: DOI for publication
@graph.rdfs:label: doi

@graph.rdfs:comment: Pubmed ID for publication
@graph.rdfs:label: pmid

@graph.rdfs:comment: url for publication
@graph.rdfs:label: url

@graph.rdfs:comment: Author list of publication
@graph.rdfs:label: author

@graph.rdfs:comment: Name of article
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date when the ScholarlyArticle was published
@graph.rdfs:label: datePublished

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".
@graph.rdfs:label: pagination

@graph.rdfs:comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "135" or "xiii".
@graph.rdfs:label: pageStart

@graph.rdfs:comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".
@graph.rdfs:label: pageEnd

@graph.rdfs:comment: Name of journal/publication of the article
@graph.rdfs:label: journalName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Abbreviated name of journal/publication of the article
@graph.rdfs:label: journalNameAbbrev

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".
@graph.rdfs:label: issueNumber

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".
@graph.rdfs:label: volumeNumber

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing an Medication for a Patient in the Center for Viral Systems Biology experiments
@graph.rdfs:label: Medication

@graph.rdfs:comment: Drug name
@graph.rdfs:label: name

@graph.rdfs:comment: Whether the drug is administered (true/false)
@graph.rdfs:label: isDrugAdministered

@graph.rdfs:comment: Date of drug administration
@graph.rdfs:label: dateAdministered

@graph.rdfs:comment: Time of drug administration
@graph.rdfs:label: timeAdministered

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dose of the drug (numeric portion), used in combination with doseUnits
@graph.rdfs:label: doseNumeric

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dose units of the drug, used in combination with doseNumeric
@graph.rdfs:label: doseUnits

@graph.rdfs:comment: Frequency of the drug administered
@graph.rdfs:label: doseFrequency

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dosing duration of the drug
@graph.rdfs:label: doseDuration

@graph.rdfs:comment: Route of the drug, such as IV, PO, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: drugRoute

_status.refresh_msg: no need to update, already at latest version

@graph.rdfs:comment: a concept or class in an ontology, vocabulary or thesaurus
@graph.rdfs:label: OntologyClass

@graph.rdfs:comment: An OWL property used as an edge label
@graph.rdfs:label: RelationshipType

@graph.rdfs:comment: an ontology class that describes a functional aspect of a gene, gene prodoct or complex
@graph.rdfs:label: GeneOntologyClass

@graph.rdfs:comment: A named entity that is either a part of an organism, a whole organism, population or clade of organisms, excluding molecular entities
@graph.rdfs:label: OrganismalEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: An individual organism that has a patient role in some clinical context.
@graph.rdfs:label: Case

@graph.rdfs:comment: Either one of a disease or an individual phenotypic feature. Some knowledge resources such as Monarch treat these as distinct, others such as MESH conflate.
@graph.rdfs:label: DiseaseOrPhenotypicFeature

@graph.rdfs:comment: A feature of the environment of an organism that influences one or more phenotypic features of that organism, potentially mediated by genes
@graph.rdfs:label: Environment

@graph.rdfs:comment: a piece of information that typically describes some piece of biology or is used as support.
@graph.rdfs:label: InformationContentEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: Level of confidence in a statement
@graph.rdfs:label: ConfidenceLevel

@graph.rdfs:comment: Class of evidence that supports an association
@graph.rdfs:label: EvidenceType

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any published piece of information. Can refer to a whole publication, or to a part of it (e.g. a figure, figure legend, or section highlighted by NLP). The scope is intended to be general and include information published on the web as well as journals.
@graph.rdfs:label: Publication

@graph.rdfs:comment: A gene, gene product, small molecule or macromolecule (including protein complex)
@graph.rdfs:label: MolecularEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: May be a chemical entity or a formulation with a chemical entity as active ingredient, or a complex material with multiple chemical entities as part
@graph.rdfs:label: ChemicalSubstance

@graph.rdfs:comment: A substance intended for use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease
@graph.rdfs:label: Drug

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any intermediate or product resulting from metabolism. Includes primary and secondary metabolites.
@graph.rdfs:label: Metabolite

@graph.rdfs:comment: A subcellular location, cell type or gross anatomical part
@graph.rdfs:label: AnatomicalEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: A stage of development or growth of an organism, including post-natal adult stages
@graph.rdfs:label: LifeStage

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any entity or process that exists at the level of the whole planet
@graph.rdfs:label: PlanetaryEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any entity or process that exists in the clinical domain and outside the biological realm. Diseases are placed under biological entities
@graph.rdfs:label: ClinicalEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment
@graph.rdfs:label: Device

@graph.rdfs:comment: an entity that can either be directly located on a genome (gene, transcript, exon, regulatory region) or is encoded in a genome (protein)
@graph.rdfs:label: GenomicEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: A genome is the sum of genetic material within a cell or virion.
@graph.rdfs:label: Genome

@graph.rdfs:comment: An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase
@graph.rdfs:label: Transcript

@graph.rdfs:comment: A region of the transcript sequence within a gene which is not removed from the primary RNA transcript by RNA splicing
@graph.rdfs:label: Exon

@graph.rdfs:comment: A union of gene, gene product, and macromolecular complex. These are the basic units of function in a cell. They either carry out individual biological activities, or they encode molecules which do this.
@graph.rdfs:label: MacromolecularMachine

@graph.rdfs:comment: a union of genes or gene products. Frequently an identifier for one will be used as proxy for another
@graph.rdfs:label: GeneOrGeneProduct

@graph.rdfs:comment: The functional molecular product of a single gene. Gene products are either proteins or functional RNA molecules
@graph.rdfs:label: GeneProduct

@graph.rdfs:comment: A gene product that is composed of a chain of amino acid sequences and is produced by ribosome-mediated translation of mRNA
@graph.rdfs:label: Protein

@graph.rdfs:comment: This is an abstract class that can be mixed in with different kinds of gene products to indicate that the gene product is intended to represent a specific isoform rather than a canonical or reference or generic product. The designation of canonical or reference may be arbitrary, or it may represent the superclass of all isoforms.
@graph.rdfs:label: GeneProductIsoform

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents a protein that is a specific isoform of the canonical or reference protein. See https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4114032/
@graph.rdfs:label: ProteinIsoform

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents a protein that is a specific isoform of the canonical or reference RNA
@graph.rdfs:label: RnaProductIsoform

@graph.rdfs:comment: any grouping of multiple genes or gene products related by common descent
@graph.rdfs:label: GeneFamily

@graph.rdfs:comment: An information content entity that describes a genome by specifying the total variation in genomic sequence and/or gene expression, relative to some extablished background
@graph.rdfs:label: Genotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: A set of zero or more Alleles on a single instance of a Sequence[VMC]
@graph.rdfs:label: Haplotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: An allele that varies in its sequence from what is considered the reference allele at that locus.
@graph.rdfs:label: SequenceVariant

@graph.rdfs:comment: A drug exposure is an intake of a particular chemical substance
@graph.rdfs:label: DrugExposure

@graph.rdfs:comment: A treatment is targeted at a disease or phenotype and may involve multiple drug 'exposures'
@graph.rdfs:label: Treatment

@graph.rdfs:comment: a location that can be described in lat/long coordinates
@graph.rdfs:label: GeographicLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: a location that can be described in lat/long coordinates, for a particular time
@graph.rdfs:label: GeographicLocationAtTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: A processual entity
@graph.rdfs:label: Occurrent

@graph.rdfs:comment: Either an individual molecular activity, or a collection of causally connected molecular activities
@graph.rdfs:label: BiologicalProcessOrActivity

@graph.rdfs:comment: An execution of a molecular function carried out by a gene product or macromolecular complex.
@graph.rdfs:label: MolecularActivity

@graph.rdfs:comment: Activity or behavior of any independent integral living, organization or mechanical actor in the world
@graph.rdfs:label: ActivityAndBehavior

@graph.rdfs:comment: A series of actions conducted in a certain order or manner
@graph.rdfs:label: Procedure

@graph.rdfs:comment: a fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause or explanation is in question
@graph.rdfs:label: Phenomenon

@graph.rdfs:comment: One or more causally connected executions of molecular functions
@graph.rdfs:label: BiologicalProcess

@graph.rdfs:comment: A location in or around a cell
@graph.rdfs:label: CellularComponent

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two genes whose phenotypic effects are dependent on each other in some way - such that their combined phenotypic effects are the result of some interaction between the activity of their gene products. Examples include epistasis and synthetic lethality.
@graph.rdfs:label: geneticallyInteractsWith

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one changes the amount of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsAbundanceOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the amount of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesAbundanceOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the amount of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesAbundanceOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one changes the activity of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsActivityOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the activity of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesActivityOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the activity of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesActivityOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one changes the level of expression of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsExpressionOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the level of expression of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesExpressionOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the level of expression of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesExpressionOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one changes the rate or quality of folding of the other
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsFoldingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate or quality of folding of the other
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesFoldingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate or quality of folding of the other
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesFoldingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one changes the localization of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsLocalizationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the proper localization of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesLocalizationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the proper localization of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesLocalizationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the metabolic processing of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsMetabolicProcessingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate of metabolic processing of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesMetabolicProcessingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate of metabolic processing of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesMetabolicProcessingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one leads changes in the molecular modification(s) of the other (e.g. via post-translational modifications of proteins such as the addition of phosphoryl group, or via redox reaction that adds or subtracts electrons)
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsMolecularModificationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one leads to increased molecular modification(s) of the other (e.g. via post-translational modifications of proteins such as the addition of phosphoryl group, or via redox reaction that adds or subtracts electrons)
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesMolecularModificationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one leads to decreased molecular modification(s) of the other (e.g. via post-translational modifications of proteins such as the addition of phosphoryl group, or via redox reaction that adds or subtracts electrons)
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesMolecularModificationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the rate of chemical synthesis of the other
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsSynthesisOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate of chemical synthesis of the other
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesSynthesisOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate of chemical synthesis of the other
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesSynthesisOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the rate of degradation of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsDegradationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate of degradation of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesDegradationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate of degradation of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesDegradationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a molecular entity and a genomic entity where the action or effect of the molecular entity impacts the rate of mutation of the genomic entity within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsMutationRateOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a molecular entity and a genomic entity where the action or effect of the molecular entity increases the rate of mutation of the genomic entity within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesMutationRateOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a molecular entity and a genomic entity where the action or effect of the molecular entity decreases the rate of mutation of the genomic entity within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesMutationRateOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the susceptibility of a biological entity or system (e.g. an organism, cell, cellular component, macromolecular machine, biological or pathological process) to the other
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsResponseTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the susceptibility of a biological entity or system (e.g. an organism, cell, cellular component, macromolecular machine, biological or pathological process) to the other
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesResponseTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the susceptibility of a biological entity or system (e.g. an organism, cell, cellular component, macromolecular machine, biological or pathological process) to the other
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesResponseTo

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a molecular entity and an mRNA where the action or effect of the molecular entity impacts the splicing of the mRNA
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsSplicingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a molecular entity and an mRNA where the action or effect of the molecular entity increases the proper splicing of the mRNA
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesSplicingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a molecular entity and an mRNA where the action or effect of the molecular entity decreases the proper splicing of the mRNA
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesSplicingOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the stability of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsStabilityOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the stability of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesStabilityOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the stability of the other within a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesStabilityOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the rate of transport of the other across some boundary in a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsTransportOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate of transport of the other across some boundary in a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesTransportOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate of transport of the other across some boundary in a system of interest
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesTransportOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the rate of secretion of the other out of a cell, gland, or organ
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsSecretionOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate of secretion of the other out of a cell, gland, or organ
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesSecretionOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate of secretion of the other out of a cell, gland, or organ
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesSecretionOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one impacts the rate of uptake of the other into of a cell, gland, or organ
@graph.rdfs:label: affectsUptakeOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one increases the rate of uptake of the other into of a cell, gland, or organ
@graph.rdfs:label: increasesUptakeOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two molecular entities where the action or effect of one decreases the rate of uptake of the other into of a cell, gland, or organ
@graph.rdfs:label: decreasesUptakeOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a gene and a transcribed and/or translated product generated from it
@graph.rdfs:label: hasGeneProduct

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two genes or gene products that are part of in the same biological pathway
@graph.rdfs:label: inPathwayWith

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two genes or gene products that are part of (or code for products that are part of) in the same macromolecular complex
@graph.rdfs:label: inComplexWith

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two genes or gene products that are expressed in the same cell type or population
@graph.rdfs:label: inCellPopulationWith

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a gene and a disease or phenotypic feature that the gene or its alleles/products may influence, contribute to, or correlate with
@graph.rdfs:label: geneAssociatedWithCondition

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a therapeutic procedure or chemical substance and a disease or phenotypic feature that it is used to treat
@graph.rdfs:label: treats

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a disease or phenotypic feature and a measurable molecular entity that is used as an indicator of the presence or state of the disease or feature.
@graph.rdfs:label: correlatedWith

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a disease or phenotypic feature and a measurable molecular entity that is used as an indicator of the presence or state of the disease or feature.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasBiomarker

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a measurable molecular entity and a disease or phenotypic feature, where the entity is used as an indicator of the presence or state of the disease or feature.
@graph.rdfs:label: biomarkerFor

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a gene or gene product and an anatomical entity in which it is expressed
@graph.rdfs:label: expressedIn

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between an anatomical entity and gene or gene product that is expressed there
@graph.rdfs:label: expresses

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between a biological entity and a phenotype, where a phenotype is construed broadly as any kind of quality of an organism part, a collection of these qualities, or a change in quality or qualities (e.g. abnormally increased temperature).
@graph.rdfs:label: hasPhenotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two processes, where one completes before the other begins
@graph.rdfs:label: precedes

@graph.rdfs:comment: holds between two classes where the domain class is a specialization of the range class
@graph.rdfs:label: subclassOf

_status.refresh_msg: no need to update, already at latest version

@graph.rdfs:comment: RNA. Version 0.1-DRAFT-2019_06_21
@graph.rdfs:label: RNA

@graph.rdfs:comment: Used to define the range of a subsequence, typically used in conjunction with SequenceAnnotation to define the range of the annotation on the protein or gene sequence. Version: 0.1-DRAFT-2019_06_21.
@graph.rdfs:label: SequenceRange

@graph.rdfs:comment: A name of a biological taxon, may it be valid (zoology) / accepted (botany) or not. Version: 0.1-DRAFT
@graph.rdfs:label: TaxonName

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Any biological, chemical, or biochemical thing. For example: a protein; a gene; a chemical; a synthetic chemical.
Version 0.8-DRAFT
@graph.rdfs:label: BioChemEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: This Study profile presents the markup when describing a Study Version: 0.3-DRAFT
@graph.rdfs:label: Study

@graph.rdfs:comment: An experimental protocol is a sequence of tasks and operations executed to perform experimental research in biological and biomedical areas. Version 0.3-DRAFT-2019_06_20
@graph.rdfs:label: LabProtocol

@graph.rdfs:comment: A phenotype. Version 0.3-DRAFT-2020_06_07
@graph.rdfs:label: Phenotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: Used to provide metadata about Sequence Annotations. The sequence can be an amino acid (protein) or nucleic acid (Gene, DNA, RNA). Version: 0.1-DRAFT-2019_06_21
@graph.rdfs:label: SequenceAnnotation

@graph.rdfs:comment: A set of organisms asserted to represent a natural cohesive biological unit. Version: 0.4-DRAFT-2019_06_24
@graph.rdfs:label: Taxon

@graph.rdfs:comment: WwPDB and related data including modelled and hypothetical data. As well as 3D data for chemicals, e.g. stereo chemistry images in an analyzable format (not pure images). Version: 0.1-DRAFT-2019_06_20 (2019-06-20). Note, the parent class for this type has been updated to a pending class in schema.org.
@graph.rdfs:label: BioChemStructure

@graph.rdfs:comment:
DNA
Version: 0.2-DRAFT-2019_06_20 (2019-06-20). Note, the parent class for this type has been updated to a pending class in schema.org.
@graph.rdfs:label: DNA

@graph.rdfs:comment: Version: 0.1-DRAFT-2019_06_20 (2019-06-20). Note, the parent class for this type has been updated to a pending class in schema.org.
@graph.rdfs:label: Enzyme

@graph.rdfs:comment: To deliver on the identified use cases for samples, we have identified a minimal set of properties to encapsulate identification, linking, and metadata descriptions. Some of these properties are existing standard schema.org properties, others require Bioschemas extensions. Table 1 outlines the minimal set of properties for the ‘Sample’ concept and Table 2 shows our recommendations for use of the ‘PropertyValue’ concept to markup additional characteristics of a sample described within a sample page. We also propose a new concept, ‘Biomedical Code’, which is a generalisation of the existing ‘Medical Code’ concept defined in the health-lifesci.schema.org extension.
@graph.rdfs:label: Sample

@graph.rdfs:comment: A model used to determine sequence matches such as domains in proteins. Version: 0.1-DRAFT-2019_06_21 (2019-06-21)
@graph.rdfs:label: SequenceMatchingModel

@graph.rdfs:comment: Protein is here used in its widest possible definition, as classes of amino acid based molecules. Amyloid-beta Protein in human (UniProt P05067), eukaryota (e.g. an OrthoDB group) or even a single molecule that one can point to are all of type schema:Protein. A protein can thus be a subclass of another protein, e.g. schema:Protein as a UniProt record can have multiple isoforms inside it which would also be schema:Protein. They can be imagined, synthetic, hypothetical or naturally occurring. This version has been added to schema.org as a pending type.
@graph.rdfs:label: Protein

@graph.rdfs:comment: A discrete unit of inheritance which affects one or more biological traits (Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene). Examples include FOXP2 (Forkhead box protein P2), SCARNA21 (small Cajal body-specific RNA 21), A- (agouti genotype). Note, this version of the type has been added as a pending class in schema.org.
@graph.rdfs:label: Gene

@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether or not this RNA is a coding one.
@graph.rdfs:label: isCodingRNA

@graph.rdfs:comment: Final position of the range
@graph.rdfs:label: rangeEnd

@graph.rdfs:comment: Initial position of the range.
@graph.rdfs:label: rangeStart

@graph.rdfs:comment: If the initial position is not known with reasonable certainty, specify here the uncertainty type as one of ‘<’ (any position before than rangeEnd), ‘>’ (any position after rangeEnd), ‘~’ (around rangeEnd), ‘[#-#] (to indicate a range where rangeEnd could be located)’.
@graph.rdfs:label: endUncertainty

@graph.rdfs:comment: If the initial position is not known with reasonable certainty, specify here the uncertainty type as one of ‘<’ (any position before than rangeStart), ‘>’ (any position after rangeStart), ‘~’ (around the rangeStart), ‘[#-#] (to indicate a range where rangeStart could be located)’.
@graph.rdfs:label: startUncertainty

@graph.rdfs:comment: A symbolic representation of a BioChemEnity. For example, a nucleotide sequence of a Gene or an amino acid sequence of a Protein.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasBioPolymerSequence

@graph.rdfs:comment: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
@graph.rdfs:label: startDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
@graph.rdfs:label: endDate

@graph.rdfs:comment: A study that is related to this one.
@graph.rdfs:label: relatedStudy

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Define the domain of the study. For example, the domain could be astrophysics, functional genomics or earth science. Those domains can also have an ontology reference. For example, in the life sciences  we could have
Functional Genomics: http://edamontology.org/topic_0085
Protemics: http://edamontology.org/topic_0121
@graph.rdfs:label: studyDomain

@graph.rdfs:comment:
A process performed as part of an experiment or wider study, i.e. intentionally designed.
These processes can have ontology URL attached to. For example, in the life sciences  we could have 
RNA-seq of coding RNA from single cells: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0005684
case control design: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0001427
@graph.rdfs:label: studyProcess

@graph.rdfs:comment: The location in which the study is taking/took place.
@graph.rdfs:label: studyLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: A subject of the study, i.e. one of the medical conditions, therapies, devices, drugs, etc. investigated by the study.
@graph.rdfs:label: studySubject

@graph.rdfs:comment: The time it takes to actually carry out the protocol in ISO 8601 date format.
@graph.rdfs:label: executionTime

@graph.rdfs:comment: For LabProtocols it would be a laboratory equipment use by a person to follow one or more steps described in this LabProtocol.
@graph.rdfs:label: labEquipment

@graph.rdfs:comment: Situations where the Protocol has been successfully employed.
@graph.rdfs:label: protocolAdvantage

@graph.rdfs:comment: Applications of the protocol list the full diversity of the applications of the method and support if is possible to extend the range of applications of the protocol. e.g. northern blot assays, sequencing, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: protocolApplication

@graph.rdfs:comment: Situations where the Protocol would be unreliable or otherwise unsuccessful.
@graph.rdfs:label: protocolLimitation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Outcome or expected result by a protocol execution.
@graph.rdfs:label: protocolOutcome

@graph.rdfs:comment: A goal towards an action is taken. Can be concrete or abstract.
@graph.rdfs:label: purpose

@graph.rdfs:comment: Reagent used in the protocol. It can be a record in a Dataset describing the reagent or a BioChemEntity corresponding to the reagent or a URL pointing to the type of reagent used. ChEBI and PubChem entities can be used whenever available. Commercial names are also acceptable (URL if possible).
@graph.rdfs:label: reagent

@graph.rdfs:comment: Sample used in the protocol. It could be a record in a Dataset describing the sample or a physical object corresponding to the sample or a URL pointing to the type of sample used.
@graph.rdfs:label: sampleUsed

@graph.rdfs:comment: Software or tool used as part of the lab protocol to complete a part of it.
@graph.rdfs:label: software

@graph.rdfs:comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection. Supersedes steps.
@graph.rdfs:label: step

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any part of an organism, typically a component of an anatomical system. Organs, tissues, and cells are all anatomical locations.
@graph.rdfs:label: anatomicalLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Disease associated to this BioChemEntity. Such disease can be a MedicalCondition or a URL. If you want to add an evidence supporting the association, please use PropertyValue.
@graph.rdfs:label: associatedDisease

@graph.rdfs:comment: BioChemEntity, e.g., gene, associated to this Phenotype and relevant for its characterization, particularly useful for the molecular basis of this Phenotype.
@graph.rdfs:label: bioChemAssociation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Molecular function performed by this BioChemEntity; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasMolecularFunction

@graph.rdfs:comment: Subcellular location where this BioChemEntity is located; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.
@graph.rdfs:label: isLocatedInSubcellularLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Biological process this BioChemEntity is involved in; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.
@graph.rdfs:label: isInvolvedInBiologicalProcess

@graph.rdfs:comment: The taxonomic grouping of the organism that expresses, encodes, or in someway related to the BioChemEntity.
@graph.rdfs:label: taxonomicRange

@graph.rdfs:comment: One of 1, 0 or -1.
@graph.rdfs:label: sequenceOrientation

@graph.rdfs:comment: value of the sequence
@graph.rdfs:label: sequenceValue

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Closest child taxa of the taxon in question.
Inverse property: parentTaxon Direct, most proximate lower-rank child taxa
@graph.rdfs:label: childTaxon

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Closest parent taxon of the taxon in question.
Inverse property: childTaxon Direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon
@graph.rdfs:label: parentTaxon

@graph.rdfs:comment: A TaxonName representing the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name for that taxon.
@graph.rdfs:label: scientificName

@graph.rdfs:comment: A TaxonName representing a scientific name, with authorship and date information if known, of a synonym of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name.
@graph.rdfs:label: alternateScientificName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Molecule, e.g., ligand, bound to this BioChem structure
@graph.rdfs:label: boundMolecule

@graph.rdfs:comment: Mass spectometry resolution in the form '<Number> <Unit of measure>', for example '2.85 Å'
@graph.rdfs:label: massResolution

@graph.rdfs:comment: Coenzymes helping this enzyme in turning substrates into products.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasCoenzyme

@graph.rdfs:comment: Cofactor helping this enzyme to function.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasCofactor

@graph.rdfs:comment: Corresponding Enzyme Commission number.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasECNumber

@graph.rdfs:comment: missing description
@graph.rdfs:label: hasKineticRate

@graph.rdfs:comment: Optimal PHs.
@graph.rdfs:label: optimalPH

@graph.rdfs:comment: Optimal temperature in the form '<Number> <Temperature unit of measure>', for example '8 Celsius', at which this enzyme performs best.
@graph.rdfs:label: optimalTemperature

@graph.rdfs:comment: Biological type targeted by this model, for instance domains or sites in proteins.
@graph.rdfs:label: biologicalType

@graph.rdfs:comment: Entity matched by this model, for instance proteins where the domain targeted by this model are found. Inverse property: isMatchedBy.
@graph.rdfs:label: match

@graph.rdfs:comment: Dataset where this matching model has been recorded.
@graph.rdfs:label: modelDataset

@graph.rdfs:comment: Representation of the model such as regular expression or image.
@graph.rdfs:label: modelSignature

@graph.rdfs:comment: Schema:  One of pseudogene, dead, killed, live, predicted, suppressed.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasStatus

@graph.rdfs:comment: Another gene which is a variation of this one.
@graph.rdfs:label: alternativeOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: Tissue, organ, biological sample, etc in which activity of this gene has been observed experimentally. For example brain, digestive system.
@graph.rdfs:label: expressedIn

@graph.rdfs:comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org. Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. https://schema.org/width, https://schema.org/color, https://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.
@graph.rdfs:label: additionalProperty

@graph.rdfs:comment: An annotation on the BioPolymerSequence associated with this BioChemEntity.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasSequenceAnnotation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Method used to create or obtain this annotation or BioChemEntity; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.
@graph.rdfs:label: creationMethod

@graph.rdfs:comment: A range/position location where this annotation or BioChemEntity is located reagrding another BioChemEntity, for instance a BioChemStructure in a Protein.
@graph.rdfs:label: sequenceLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Nucleotide or amino acid sequence.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasSequence

@graph.rdfs:comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.
@graph.rdfs:label: valueReference

@graph.rdfs:comment: Used to define the actual protein or RNA.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasAssociatedBioChemEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: A model matching this BioChemEntity.
@graph.rdfs:label: isMatchedBy

@graph.rdfs:comment: The taxonomic rank of this taxon given preferably as a URI from a controlled vocabulary – (typically the ranks from TDWG TaxonRank ontology or equivalent Wikidata URIs).
@graph.rdfs:label: taxonRank

@graph.rdfs:comment: Another BioChemEntity encoded by this one. Inverse property: isEncodedByBioChemEntity.
@graph.rdfs:label: encodesBioChemEntity

@graph.rdfs:comment: Used to state the Bioschemas profile that the markup relates to. The versioned URL of the profile must be used. Note that we use a CURIE in the table here but the full URL for Dublin Core terms must be used in the markup (http://purl.org/dc/terms/conformsTo), see example.
@graph.rdfs:label: conformsTo

_status.refresh_msg: no need to update, already at latest version

@graph.rdfs:comment:
This Gene profile specification presents the markup for describing a Gene. Version 1.1-DRAFT.

Summary of Changes

Changes since 1.0-RELEASE:
  • Updated type properties to Schema.org pending release.
  • Addition of hasSequenceAnnotation property at Recommended level.
  • Added sameAs as recommended.
  • Remove use of mainEntityOfPage; DataRecord has been deprecated.
@graph.rdfs:label: Gene

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

name.description: The name of the item.

encodesBioChemEntity.description: For genes, this property is used to express in a generic way gene products encoded by this gene, for instance RNA or Protein

hasSequenceAnnotation.description: The taxonomic grouping of the organism that expresses, encodes, or in someway related to the BioChemEntity.

isPartOfBioChemEntity.description: Indicates a BioChemEntity that is (in some sense) a part of this BioChemEntity. Inverse property: hasBioChemEntityPart. For genes, it is recommended to at least specify the DNA/chromosome containing this gene.

url.description: URL of the item.

alternateName.description: An alias for the item.

alternativeOf.description: Is variant of. Use this property to express when a gene is a variant of any other gene.

associatedDisease.description: Disease associated to this BioChemEntity. Such a disease can be a MedicalCondition or a URL. If you want to add an evidence supporting the association, please use PropertyValue.

expressedIn.description: Tissue, organ, biological sample, etc in which activity of this gene has been observed experimentally. For example brain, digestive system.

hasBioChemEntityPart.description: Indicates a BioChemEntity that (in some sense) has this BioChemEntity as a part. Inverse property: isPartOfBioChemEntity

hasBioPolymerSequence.description: Schema:  A symbolic representation of a BioChemEnity. For example, a nucleotide sequence of a Gene or an amino acid sequence of a Protein.

hasMolecularFunction.description: Molecular function performed by this BioChemEntity; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

hasRepresentation.description: A common representation such as a protein sequence or chemical structure for this entity. For images use schema.org/image.

hasStatus.description: Schema:  One of pseudogene, dead, killed, live, predicted, suppressed.

image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

isInvolvedInBiologicalProcess.description: Biological process this BioChemEntity is involved in; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

isLocatedInSubcellularLocation.description: Subcellular location where this BioChemEntity is located; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

taxonomicRange.description: The taxonomic grouping of the organism that expresses, encodes, or in someway related to the BioChemEntity.

conformsTo.description: This is used to state the Bioschemas profile that the markup relates to. The identifier can be the url for the version of this bioschemas class on github: https://github.com/BioSchemas/specifications/blob/master/Gene/jsonld/Gene_v1.1-DRAFT.json

identifier.description: The url of the version bioschemas profile that was used. For jsonschema, set @id to the identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Bioschemas profile for describing a biological taxon This profile aims to denote a taxon by common properties such as its scientific name, taxonomic rank and vernacular names. It is also a means to link to existing taxonomic registers where each taxon has a URI. Version 0.8-DRAFT.

Summary of Changes


Changes since 0.7-DRAFT:
  • Change sameAs from optional to recommended.
@graph.rdfs:label: Taxon

additionalType.description: A Taxon type from a well known vocabulary, e.g. DarwinCore http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/Taxon or http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/TaxonConcept#TaxonConcept An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

alternateName.description: Scientific name, with authorship and date information if known, of a synonym of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name. An alias for the item.

alternateScientificName.description: A TaxonName representing a scientific name, with authorship and date information if known, of a synonym of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name

childTaxon.description:
Direct, most proximate lower-rank child taxa Closest child taxa of the taxon in question.
Inverse property: parentTaxon

disambiguatingDescription.description: Can be used to specify the taxon circumscription retained in this description, e.g. by denoting the scientific works that assert the status of the accepted/valid name and synonyms. A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

vernacularName.description: A vernacular (common) name of the taxon

identifier.description:
