@graph.rdfs:comment: This is the Person schema for describing authors and people for outbreak.info resources
@graph.rdfs:label: Person

name.description: The name of the person.

alternateName.description: An alias for the person.

familyName.description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

givenName.description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

affiliation.description: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

orcid.description: the ORCID ID of the person

role.description: authorship, sponsorship, or other contribution role played by the person or organization in the creation of this resource

curationDate.description: The date this resource was added into outbreak.info, or was updated in outbreak.info.

@graph.rdfs:comment: the ORCID ID of the person
@graph.rdfs:label: orcid

@graph.rdfs:comment: This is the organization schema for describing authors, funders and other organizations referenced by outbreak.info resources
@graph.rdfs:label: Organization

name.description: The name of the organization.

alternateName.description: An alias or acronym for the organization.

affiliation.description: consortia or other organizations with which this organization is affiliated

class.description: A classification of the organization by a resource. Eg- for ClinicalTrials funders, it's [U.S. National Institutes of Health, Other U.S. Federal agencies, Industry, All others]

role.description: The role of an organization in its involvement with a resource

members.description: Members of this organization, team, or group

curationDate.description: The date this resource was added into outbreak.info, or was updated in outbreak.info.

name.description: name of the organization

alternateName.description: Alternate name or Acronym for the organization.

affiliation.description: consortia or other organizations with which this person is affiliated

@graph.rdfs:label: affiliation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Members of this organization, team, or group
@graph.rdfs:label: members

@graph.rdfs:comment: This is the schema for describing the Protocols for outbreak.info Resources.
@graph.rdfs:label: Protocol

instrument.description: For LabProtocols it would be a laboratory equipment use by a person to follow one or more steps described in this LabProtocol.

protocolCategory.description: The type of 'protocol' based on degree of specificity and purpose

usedToGenerate.description: Type of evidence/data generated by the protocol

author.description: person, people, or organization that created the protocol

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a minimal ComputationalTool for the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease (NIAID). A ComputationalTool is a software used for the collection, processing, distribution, analysis, visualization, interpretation, etc. of data. Additional schema.org and/or custom properties could be added.
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalTool

name.description: Descriptive name of the computational tool

description.description: Longer description of what is contained in the computational tool

identifier.description: Identifiers for the computational tool (ideally less than 15 characters)

creator.description: Name of the author or organization that created the computational tool.  Note: schema.org/creator and schema.org/organization have additional fields that can provide more information about the author/organization, if desired.

sdPublisher.description: Original publisher of the ComputationalTool metadata (like GitHub). Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The sdPublisher property helps make such practices more explicit.

url.description: software/code location.

dateModified.description: date when the computational tool has been modified

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'. Use an EDAM:Topic to describe the category of application

codeRepository.description: Link to the source code repository of the tool.

programmingLanguage.description: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool. Please use terms from the ‘Programming language’ table in the Bio.Tools documentation

softwareVersion.description: Version(s) of the tool, which this information is valid for. Can also be a comma-delimited list and include hyphen-separated ranges of versions.

featureList.description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications). Functionality provided by the tool. This is similar to measurementTechnique in Dataset.

@graph.rdfs:comment: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.
@graph.rdfs:label: Google

name.description: A descriptive name of a dataset.

alternateName.description: Alternative names that have been used to refer to this dataset, such as aliases or abbreviations.

description.description: A short summary describing a dataset.

distribution.description: The description of the location for download of the dataset and the file format for download.

url.description: Location of a page describing the dataset.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the dataset's identity, usually in a different repository.

keywords.description: Keywords summarizing the dataset.

version.description: The version number for the dataset.

temporalCoverage.description: The data in the dataset covers a specific time interval. Only include this property if the dataset has a temporal dimension. Schema.org uses the ISO 8601 standard to describe time intervals and time points. You can describe dates differently depending upon the dataset interval. Indicate open-ended intervals with two decimal points (..).

variableMeasured.description: The variable that this dataset measures. For example, temperature or pressure.

identifier.description: An identifier, such as a DOI or a Compact Identifier. If the dataset has more than one identifier, repeat the identifier property. If using JSON-LD, this is represented using JSON list syntax.

creator.description: The creator or author of this dataset. To uniquely identify individuals, use ORCID ID as the value of the sameAs property of the Person type. To uniquely identify institutions and organizations, use ROR ID.

contributor.description: The other contributor(s) of this dataset, besides the creator

spatialCoverage.description: You can provide a single point that describes the spatial aspect of the dataset. Only include this property if the dataset has a spatial dimension. For example, a single point where all the measurements were collected, or the coordinates of a bounding box for an area.

citation.description: Identifies academic articles that are recommended by the data provider be cited in addition to the dataset itself. Provide the citation for the dataset itself with other properties, such as name, identifier, creator, and publisher properties. For example, this property can uniquely identify a related academic publication such as a data descriptor, data paper, or an article for which this dataset is supplementary material for.

identifier.description: use PubMed id here
